intro: Licaria reclinata, commonly known as the hanging licaria, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its trailing stems and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. Its leaves are ovate and hairy, often with a fuzzy texture. Licaria reclinata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in various soil conditions.
